channel.title: International: Top News And Analysis
channel.description: CNBC International is the world leader for news on business, technology, China, trade, oil prices, the Middle East and markets.

item.title: CrowdStrike issue causes major outage affecting businesses around the world
item.description: An update by cybersecurity firm CrowdStrike led to a major outage on Friday, the company told NBC, which impacted businesses globally.

item.title: Microsoft, CrowdStrike shares fall in premarket trading after major outage hits businesses worldwide
item.description: Cybersecurity firm CrowdStrike saw its shares plunge Friday in premarket trading, after an update led to a major outage, impacting businesses globally.

item.title: Britain's Labour faces an uphill battle as it looks to rein in AI's key players
item.description: The U.K. was expected to introduce formal legislation for artificial intelligence this week — but that didn't happen. Now, all eyes are on what happens next.

item.title: Microsoft says it restored cloud services after outage but 'blue screen of death' persists for many
item.description: Microsoft's cloud services have been restored after an outage, the company said on Friday, but many users are still reporting issues.

item.title: Ukraine risks North and South Korea-like division, says former Singapore diplomat
item.description: Russia's war on Ukraine could end with the latter being divided into two — like North and South Korea, says Singapore's former ambassador to Russia, Bilarhari Kausikan.

item.title: This is the right age to give your child a smartphone, according to an NYU mental health researcher
item.description: Zach Rausch, lead researcher for the No. 1 New York Times bestseller "The Anxious Generation," said it's important to keep smartphones away from preteens.

item.title: In the face of trade tensions, China says it will focus on its own economy
item.description: Top Chinese officials on Friday emphasized the country would focus on its own affairs in the face of rising trade tensions.

item.title: A new Raffles hotel opened in India's 'Pink City.’ Here's what it looks like inside
item.description: Raffles Jaipur is a 50-room luxury hotel in the heart of Rajasthan's capital city.

item.title: Packing your bags for Paris? Here’s what to expect from a visit this summer
item.description: The key to enjoying a trip to Paris, this summer or at any time, is knowing what to expect before you arrive.

item.title: China calls for bolstering tech 'breakthroughs' and achieving the full-year growth target
item.description: China's top leaders met from Monday to Thursday in Beijing for a highly anticipated policy meeting called the Third Plenum.

item.title: Trump RNC speech details assassination attempt: 'I'm not supposed to be here tonight'
item.description: Trump only mentioned President Joe Biden by name a few times — a striking shift away from the personal attacks that typically pepper his political speeches.

item.title: Democratic megadonors push Biden to quit race, as Kamala Harris events fill up
item.description: Donors who fund the Biden campaign are using their leverage with congressional leaders to pressure the president to drop out.

item.title: China's cooking oil scandal prompts residents to buy oil presses amid food safety concerns
item.description: A food safety controversy over cooking oil has sparked widespread anger among the public — and locals are taking it into their own hands to procure supplies.

item.title: Asia-Pacific markets track Wall Street slide on tech sell-off; Japan headline inflation holds steady
item.description: Japan's headline inflation was unchanged from May at 2.8%, while core inflation, which strips out prices of fresh food, accelerated to 2.6%, from 2.5% in May.

item.title: Netflix beats estimates as ad-supported memberships rise 34%
item.description: Advertising has become an increasingly important business model for media companies to boost — or in some cases, achieve — profitability for streaming.

item.title: CNBC's Inside India newsletter: How will India spend its billions?
item.description: There are high expectations for a "populist" budget since the recent general election results delivered a slimmer than expected win for Modi.

item.title: What happens next if Biden drops out of the presidential race
item.description: Biden's campaign crisis has put a spotlight on Vice President Kamala Harris, who is widely viewed as the likeliest choice to replace him.

item.title: CNBC Daily Open: Dow drops, Netflix beats estimates, Nvidia rebounds
item.description: The Dow Jones Industrial Average dropped more than 500 points as investors trimmed positions in technology stocks and booked profits in other sectors.

item.title: Second Democratic senator urges Biden to drop out of election against Trump
item.description: President Joe Biden to date has flatly rejected calls to exit the 2024 election contest against Donald Trump.

item.title: U.S.-China tensions are not a 'new Cold War,' veteran Singapore diplomat Bilahari Kausikan says
item.description: The term is "misleading" and only bears "superficial similarities to the U.S.-Soviet competition of [an] earlier era," he says.

item.title: Nvidia rebounds after TSMC says AI chip demand remains strong
item.description: Nvidia's rise came after TSMC said on Thursday that demand remains high and supply remains constrained for high-end AI chips.

item.title: Inside evolving FIFA 2026 World Cup plan to cash in on the rise of high-end sports tourism
item.description: The 2026 World Cup is expected to be one of the most in-demand sports tickets of all-time, and there will be plenty of high-end hospitality packages available.

item.title: Boeing’s missteps have cost it billions. Here’s how it plans to get back to glory
item.description: Boeing's leaders say they have charted a path forward to fix the company. They still have plenty of people to convince.

item.title: The West must be ready to face the 'deadly quartet' of global adversaries, analysts warn
item.description: Former NATO chief George Robertson warned Tuesday that the U.K.'s armed forces must have the capacity to challenge a "deadly quartet" of rivals.

item.title: Harris hits the campaign trail under spotlight as Biden faces mounting pressure to drop out
item.description: Biden is currently self-isolating in Delaware after testing positive for Covid-19 on Wednesday.

item.title: European Central Bank holds interest rates, says domestic price pressures 'still high'
item.description: The European Central Bank held its latest monetary policy meeting in Frankfurt, Germany.

item.title: Citadel's Ken Griffin buys a stegosaurus for $45 million in a record auction sale
item.description: Ken Griffin purchased a late Jurassic stegosaurus skeleton for $44.6 million at Sotheby's on Wednesday, marking the most valuable fossil ever sold at auction.

item.title: TSMC second-quarter profit beats expectations as AI chip boom continues
item.description: TSMC on Thursday beat revenue and profit expectations in the second quarter, as demand for advanced chips used in AI applications continue to surge.

item.title: JD Vance blames U.S. wage losses on China's efforts to build its middle class
item.description: U.S. presidential hopeful Donald Trump's new running mate JD Vance stuck to a hard line on China in his first speech since being selected earlier in the week.

item.title: Socialist AI: Chinese regulators are reviewing GenAI models for 'core socialist values,' FT reports
